title: Here's what's new on Hulu in August 2022, and what's leaving; Get ready for a new season of 'Reservation Dogs,' a 'Predator' prequel, a Mike Tyson bio-series, a Steve Carell thriller and much more
text:
Trevante Rhodes stars as the controversial boxing champ Mike Tyson in "Mike" (Aug. 25), an eight-episode limited series. The unauthorized biography aims to delve deep into Tyson's turbulent personal life and boxing career, and comes from a screenwriter familiar with sports biopics: Steven Rogers ("I, Tonya").

Also see: What's coming in August to Netflix | HBO Max| Disney+

Still on the sports theme, Hulu will also roll out "Legacy: The True Story of the L.A. Lakers" (Aug. 15), a limited documentary series about the "Showtime"-era 1980s Lakers (unlike HBO's recent "Winning Time: The Rise of the Lakers Dynasty," this series has the approval of then-owner Jerry Buss's family and others from that era), and "Welcome to Wrexham" (Aug. 25), a docuseries about a small Welsh soccer team after it gets bought by actors Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney.

There's also "The Patient" (Aug. 30), a psychological-thriller miniseries starring Steve Carell as a therapist held prisoner by his serial-killer client (Domhnall Gleeson); "On the Count of Three" (Aug. 17), a dark comedy movie about two friends on the last day of their lives that's the directorial debut of comedian Jerrod Carmichael; and "Prey" (Aug. 5), a "Predator" prequel about a Comanche warrior (Amber Midthunder) defending her tribe against an alien hunter.

There's plenty more on tap for the Disney DIS-controlled streaming service. Here's the complete list of what's coming and what's leaving, as of July 20 (release dates are subject to change):
